text: Robert Maynard Pirsig (September 6, 1928 - April 24, 2017)"Robert M(aynard) Pirsig." Contemporary Popular Writers. Ed. Dave Mote. Detroit: St. James Press, 1997. Gale Biography in Context. Web. September 1, 2012. was an American writer and philosopher. He is known for writing many philosophy books. They include: Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance: An Inquiry into Values (1974) and Lila: An Inquiry into Morals (1991). Pirsig was born in Minneapolis, Minnesota. He died on April 24, 2017 at his home in South Berwick, Maine from a long-illness, aged 88. ==References== ==Other websites== * Timeline of Pirsig's life * Pirsig bio from the American Society of Authors and Writers Category:1928 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in Maine Category:People with schizophrenia Category:American philosophers Category:Writers from Minneapolis
